english_title: The Book on the Two Eids

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 530
hadith_list.english_text: "It is from the SUnnah to leave for the Eid walking, and to eat something before leaving."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 531
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger, Abu Bakr, and Umar would pray during the two Eid before the Khutbah, then they would give the Khutbah."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 532
hadith_list.english_text: "I prayed the two Eid prayers with the Prophet - not one time, not two times - without and Adhan nor an Iqamah."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 533
hadith_list.english_text: "For the two Eid and the Friday prayer, the Prophet would recite: Glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most High, and Has there come to you the narration of the overwhelming? And sometimes they would occur on he same day, so he would recite the two of them."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 534
hadith_list.narrator: Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah narrated:
hadith_list.english_text: "Umar bin Al-Khattab asked Abu Waqid Al-Laithi what Allah's Messenger would recite during Al-Fitr and Al-Adha, so he said: 'He would recite: Qaf, By the Glorious Quran and the Hour has drawn near, and the moon has been cleft asunder.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 535
hadith_list.english_text: There is a another chain with similar narration.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 536
hadith_list.narrator: Kathir bin Abdullah narrated from this father, from his grandfather:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet said the Takbir in the first (Rak'ah) sever (times) before the recitation, and in the last, five (times) before the recitation."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 537
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet went out on the day of Al-Fitr, so he prayed two Rak'ah, then he did not pray before it nor after it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 538
hadith_list.narrator: Abu Bakr bin Hafs - and he is Ibn Umar bin Sa'd bin Abi Waqas - narrated about Ibn Umar, that:
hadith_list.english_text: "He went out on the day of Eid, and he did not pray before it nor after it. He mentioned that the Prophet did so."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 539
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger would order the virgins, the mature women, the secluded and the menstruating to go out for the two Eid. As for the menstruating women, they were to stay away from the Musalla and participate in the Muslims supplications." One of them said: 'O Messenger of Allah! What if she does not have a Jilbab? He said: 'Then let her sis lend her a Jilbab.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 540
hadith_list.narrator: There is a similar narration from Umm Atiyyah :

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 541
hadith_list.english_text: "When Allah's Messenger would go out on the day of Eid by one route, he would return by another."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 542
hadith_list.narrator: Abdullah bin Buraidah narrated from his father:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet would not leave on the Day of Fitr until he ate, and he would not eat on the day of Adha until he prayed."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 543
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet would have a breakfast of dates on the Day of Fitr before leaving for the Musalla."
